Posts.Content: Mastitis can present with the same symptoms but it is imperative that a breast specialist rule out inflammatory breast cancer as the cause.
Posts.Title: other breast conditions

Posts.Content: On 9/13/2007 aprilmayspring wrote: I'm having very stronge burning sensations and pain in my left breast, but no lump, is that a sign of breast cancer. Inflammatory breast cancer can present as swelling, itching, buring, and pinkish coloration, to name a few symptoms. There would not be a lump in the case of IBC. You should see a breast specialist immediately.
Posts.Title: Is burning and pain a sign.

Posts.Content: On 9/10/2007 christy1975 wrote: Hi, I am a 31 year old mom of 2. I have been told by a breast specialist that i have some fibrocrstic tissue in my left breast, but lately my right breast seems to be a bit larger than my left breast. I don't know if it matters or not but I don't get normal periods and havent had one this month I am about a week late and am not sure if this could be related, I plan on going to the doctors I just wanted to get some info on what this could possible be before I go. I don't have any other symptoms. Inflammatory breast cancer can present with swelling, redness, and itching, to name a few symptoms. No lump would be felt. You should report your symptoms to your breast specialist right away.
Posts.Title: Could this be cancer?
